main event: Two white lights were observed in the sky over Coldwater, Ohio on September 20, 1964.
interesting points: The lights appeared as two distant lights, with no visible objects - only the lights were observed.
The lights changed in brightness and disappeared at the western horizon.
The lights were vertically spaced, suggesting they may have been on the same object.
The sighting lasted for about 20 seconds.
The witness could not provide an estimate of the speed or distance of the object.
